item.title: State to work on attracting small tour groups - The Star Online
item.description:
State to work on attracting small tour groups  The Star Online

PERAK wants to promote more tour packages to cater to small tour groups. State Tourism, Arts and Culture Committee chairman Tan Kar Hing (PH-Simpang Pulai) said there were several niche markets in the state that could attract these smaller groups, most likely comprising friends and families. “Based on research done by the state, we want to reposition Perak tourism by focusing on repositioning, rebranding and segmentation. “Perak has various eco-tourism spots, historical monuments and theme parks that will attract the smaller groups. It will be aptly named the Friends and Family Tourism prog...

item.title: Perak MB not taking any action against plot to topple him - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Malaysiakini

Perak Menteri Besar Ahmad Faizal Azumu said he is not taking any action on the claim of a plot to topple him and leaving the matter to the discretion of the authorities concerned to investigate. The State Pakatan Harapan chairperson said he did not see any wrongdoing by the state executive council (exco) members that were alleged by state opposition leader Saarani Mohamad to be in a plot to topple him. "We don't see any wrongdoing within the exco members or Harapan members, so why do we need to take any action... but if the authorities, like MACC and the police think that there is any wrong...

item.title: Increase in tourist arrivals for 2018 - The Star Online
item.description:
Increase in tourist arrivals for 2018  The Star Online

THE Perak government is expecting an increase of 6% in domestic tourists to the state for 2018. State Tourism, Arts and Culture Committee chairman Tan Kar Hing said in 2017, a total of 7.6 million domestic tourists visited Perak. Tan said Perak was still in second place in terms of domestic tourist arrivals since 2015. “However, the statistics on tourists for this year cannot be shown as yet, because a report will only be available in mid-June next year,” he said in reply to Mohd Akmal Kamarudin (Umno-Selama) at the state assembly. Mohd Akmal had asked about the state government’s target of...

item.title: Perak MB willing to assist MACC over alleged plot to topple him - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak MB willing to assist MACC over alleged plot to topple him  The Star Online

IPOH: Perak Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Ahmad Faizal Azumu is willing to assist the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) in the investigation over the plot to topple him. However, he doubt he would be able to help much in the probe. “I have no problems if I am called. I am good with everyone,” he told reporters after opening a seminar for local councillors here. Ahmad Faizal said he could only tell MACC what he knew, and what the media has informed him. He was commenting on reports about Perak opposition leader Datuk Saarani Mohamad claiming that Perak DAP vice-chairman Dr Abdul Aziz Bar...

item.title: Hype of no confidence vote against Perak MB fizzles out - The Star Online
item.description:
Hype of no confidence vote against Perak MB fizzles out  The Star Online

IPOH: The anticipated vote of no confidence against Perak Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Ahmad Faizal Azumu (pic) did not materialise at the end of the six-day state assembly sitting. Perak DAP chairman Nga Kor Ming said this was due to the united support by all the state’s Pakatan Harapan assemblymen for Ahmad Faizal. He added that there was no move to topple Ahmad Faizal, and that the opposition was merely making an attempt to create chaos in Perak. “Today (Wednesday) is the last day of the state assembly sitting and Ahmad Faizal is still the Perak Mentri Besar. “This is proof that the state opp...

item.title: Perak MB: No plans to sell MAPS - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak MB: No plans to sell MAPS  The Star Online

IPOH: The Perak government has no plans to sell the Movie Animation Park Studio (MAPS), says Perak Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Ahmad Faizal Azumu (pic). Ahmad Faizal was responding to Nga Kor Ming (DAP-Aulong) who suggested that the government should sell the state-owned theme park to private companies during today’s assembly sitting. “I welcome all suggestions from state assembly members, but I believe he did not receive the latest information about MAPS. The theme park is doing well. They have received an increasing number of visitors coming in," said Ahmad Faizal. He added that the park coul...

item.title: Abdul Aziz Bari: I'm not out to oust Perak MB - The Star Online
item.description:
Abdul Aziz Bari: I'm not out to oust Perak MB  The Star Online

IPOH: Perak DAP vice-chairman Dr Abdul Aziz Bari (pic) has denied he is the state executive councillor out to topple the Mentri Besar. Denying Datuk Saarani Mohamad's allegations, Abdul Aziz said the Perak opposition leader can be considered as having lied about the matter if Datuk Seri Ahmad Faizal Azumu still remains the Mentri Besar until Wednesday (Dec 5), which is the last day of the state assembly sitting. Abdul Aziz, who is also Tebing Tinggi assemblyman, said Saarani keeps harping on plans to oust the Mentri Besar, and had allegedly mentioned his name during the sitting. “He said I ...

item.title: AirAsia's Singapore to Ipoh direct flight takes off - The Star Online
item.description:
AirAsia's Singapore to Ipoh direct flight takes off  The Star Online

IPOH: AirAsia made its maiden direct flight from Singapore to Ipoh on Monday (Dec 3). The flight carrying 166 passengers departed from Singapore Changi Airport at 11.40am and arrived at the Sultan Azlan Shah Airport in Ipoh at 1pm. On arrival, passengers were greeted by Perak Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Ahmad Faizal Azumu. Also present were state Tourism, Arts and Culture Committee chairman Tan Kar Hing, state Housing and Local Government Committee chairman Paul Yong Choo Kiong, Tourism Perak chief executive officer Zuraida Md Taib and AirAsia chief executive officer Riad Asmat. Ahmad Faizal sa...

item.title: Perak Umno chief not scared of Pakatan's police report on alleged anti-MB coup - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak Umno chief not scared of Pakatan's police report on alleged anti-MB coup  The Star Online

IPOH: Perak Umno chief Datuk Saarani Mohamad (pic) says he is not scared of the police report of the alleged plot to oust the Mentri Besar, and ready to be called in by the police to give his statement. He was commenting on the police report on the alleged coup attempt lodged at the Dangi Wangi police headquarters in Kuala Lumpur on Wednesday (Nov 28) by Pakatan Harapan secretariat chief and Batu Gajah MP V. Sivakumar. “Do not think that we are scared, and that they can threaten me and my friends by lodging a police report," said Saarani who is also the state's opposition leader. “Sivakumar...

item.title: 9,000 state civil servants to receive special payments, says Perak MB - The Star Online
item.description:
9,000 state civil servants to receive special payments, says Perak MB  The Star Online

IPOH: Some 9,000 civil servants in Perak will receive special payments in two instalments, says Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Ahmad Faizal Azumu. He said this was as a tribute to the commitment and dedication of the civil servants, and the payment would be done under special financial assistance. He said they would receive one month’s salary or a minimum of RM2,000, paid in two instalments, at the end of December and May next year. “The special payment will also be extended to, among others, temporary teachers, Islamic kindergarten teachers under the state religious department, village chiefs and...

item.title: Perak MB: We are 'one big happy family' - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak MB: We are 'one big happy family'  The Star Online

IPOH: "We are one big happy family", Perak Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Ahmad Faizal Azumu (pic) said in response to claims of a plot by some state executive councillor members to oust him. Ahmad Faizal said his relationship with all ten Perak exco members was good. He said weekly meetings are held, where all exco members have a chance to voice their views and suggestions for the betterment of the state. Recently, Perak opposition leader Datuk Saarani Mohamad claimed there was an impending vote of no-confidence against Ahmad Faizal. He said he was willing to reveal the names of the exco members ...

item.title: It's 'Buy Perak First' for govt agencies in Perak - The Star Online
item.description:
It's 'Buy Perak First' for govt agencies in Perak  The Star Online

IPOH: All Perak governmental agencies have been instructed to go local when procuring services or products. State Investment Committee chairman Datuk Seri Mohammad Nizar Jamaluddin said the state had started a "Buy Perak First" policy to ensure that state-based companies got the first nod for projects or services. "Those needing services, contractors or materials need to give priority to state-based companies or those owned by Perakians. "This includes flood mitigations or housing projects, water products, spare parts or other services," he told reporters during a trade agency seminar for e...

item.title: Coup attempt in Perak is not over - The Star Online
item.description:
Coup attempt in Perak is not over  The Star Online

PERAK Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Ahmad Faizal Azumu (pic) is either a very good actor or he has nerves of steel. He has been his usual chirpy and upbeat self throughout the state assembly sitting despite intense speculation of a plot to unseat him as MB. Such things would have given most politicians sleepless nights, but Ahmad Faizal seems to have taken it in his stride. He has been wearing his biggest smile since the assembly sitting began on Tuesday. He described the government bench as “one big, happy family”, held a press conference with personalities seen as part of the plot and ordered p...

item.title: All 25 Umno reps walk out of Perak state assembly, accuse Speaker of bias - The Star Online
item.description:
All 25 Umno reps walk out of Perak state assembly, accuse Speaker of bias  The Star Online

IPOH: All 25 Umno state assemblymen staged a walkout after accusing the Perak state assembly speaker Datuk Ngeh Koo Ham of being biased. It started when Perak Opposition leader Datuk Saarani Ibrahim "congratulated" Ngeh as the richest MP at the end of his debate speech, and asked if he could explain how he had become so rich. To that, Ngeh replied his assets were due to profits from properties gains. He added that he would have been richer if not for the "coup" 10 years ago (when Barisan Nasional took over the state government after getting three assemblymen to cross over) and that he would...

item.title: State offers Tanjung Malimfor third national car project - The Star Online
item.description:
State offers Tanjung Malimfor third national car project  The Star Online

THE Perak Government is offering Tanjung Malim to set up the hub for the third national car project, in the event it takes off. State Industry, Investment and Corridor Development Committee chairman Datuk Seri Mohammad Nizar Jamaluddin (PH-Sungai Rapat) said this effort was to complement the current Proton City located there. He said the third national car project was still on the drawing board and nothing concrete materialised. “We are already looking for sites at the district that will be able to hold such a hub, and once the project is confirmed, we will offer Tanjung Malim as a port. “...

item.title: Ngeh: I’m not the richest MP - The Star Online
item.description:
Ngeh: I’m not the richest MP  The Star Online

IPOH: Despite having assets amounting to RM80mil, DAP’s Beruas MP Datuk Ngeh Koo Ham (pic) claims he is not the richest Member of Parliament. “There are many more MPs who have assets worth hundreds of millions, if not billions. “So my assets are much less compared to billions,” he told a press conference after announcing the coming state assembly sitting at the state secretariat building here yesterday. The Perak state assembly speaker tops the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) asset declaration list, followed by Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad, who has accumulated assets w...

item.title: Probe Umno's claims of plans to overthrow MB, Perak Bersatu Youth tells Pakatan govt - The Star Online
item.description:
Probe Umno's claims of plans to overthrow MB, Perak Bersatu Youth tells Pakatan govt  The Star Online

IPOH: Perak Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia is urging the Pakatan Harapan leadership to investigate claims of certain state executive councillors making offers to Umno assemblymen to overthrow the Mentri Besar. State Bersatu Youth chief Mohd Hafez Mubin Mohd Salleh they viewed the matter seriously. He said stern action must be taken if there is any truth to the claims made by state Umno chairman Datuk Saarani Mohamad. "The state executive councillors must be fired or dropped as exco members, and disciplinary action must be taken. "This is because such an act of conspiring with Opposition ass...

item.title: State’s first investors’ expo to be held next year - The Star Online
item.description:
State’s first investors’ expo to be held next year  The Star Online

THE Perak government plans to hold its first-ever international exhibition to attract investors into the state. State Investment and Corridor Develop-ment Committee chairman Datuk Seri Mohammad Nizar Jamaluddin (pic) said the exhibition would take place in July next year, jointly organised with several local chambers of commerce. “The exhibition is meant to encourage both international and domestic investors to invest in the state. “It is co-organised with the Perak Chinese Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Perak Malay Chamber of Commerce and the Perak Indian Chamber of Commerce,” he said d...

item.title: The Sungai Siput conundrum - The Star Online
item.description:
The Sungai Siput conundrum  The Star Online

IN 2008, Dr Michael Jeyakumar Devaraj was one of the giant-killing success stories. Representing the small Parti Sosialis Malaysia (PSM), he managed to topple Datuk Seri Samy Vellu in Sungai Siput, a seat that had only been held by Samy Vellu and Tun Sambanthan since the country’s independence. However, during the historic 14th General Election that toppled the hitherto omnipotent Barisan National, Dr Jeyakumar became one of the casualties, garnering less than four percent of the votes and losing his deposit as voters chose the relatively unknown Kesavan Subra­man­iam of Parti Keadilan Raky...

item.title: Coming full circle - The Star Online
item.description:
Coming full circle  The Star Online

FORMER Sungai Siput MP Dr Michael Jeyakumar Devaraj is no longer the sole socialist representative in parliament. This means, arguably, that there is no one there to speak for the left as New Malaysia finds its way. Yet Dr Jeyakumar finds some encouragement, both in some of steps taken in the post-Barisan Nasional era and in the fact that he can now focus on grassroots activism again. “I think it’s a fantastic watershed event for Malaysia to have a new government after all this time. I think it’s a big step forward and it has given a lot of hope to young people that things can be changed – ...

item.title: Decision to summon Zambry, Aminudin for PAC hearing done unilaterally, claims Perak PAC member - The Star Online
item.description:
Decision to summon Zambry, Aminudin for PAC hearing done unilaterally, claims Perak PAC member  The Star Online

IPOH: Perak Public Accounts Committee (PAC) chairman Leong Cheok Keng has been accused of jumping the gun in announcing that Datuk Seri Zambry Abd Kadir and Datuk Aminudin Hashim would be summoned to attend the inquiry into the financial records of Mentri Besar Incorporated (MB Inc). PAC member Pengkalan Hulu assemblyman Datuk Aznel Ibrahim of Barisan Nasional said during the committee meeting on Nov 15, they had not decided on whether Dr Zambry, the former Perak Mentri Besar, and Aminudin, who is the ex-MB Inc chief executive officer, should be summoned for the hearing. Aznel said Leong ha...

item.title: ‘No plastic bag’ campaign begins in Batu Gajah - The Star Online
item.description:
‘No plastic bag’ campaign begins in Batu Gajah  The Star Online

THE Batu Gajah District Council kick-started its first-ever “No Non-Degradable Plastic Bag Day” initiative. Council president Mohamad Razif Ramli said the initiative was their first step towards making the district sustainable and to be more responsible towards the environment. There are 24 zones in Batu Gajah and Zone 3, which encompassed about 20 areas, was the first selected for the initiative. Among the areas in Zone 3 included Kampung Ara Payung, Kampung Muhibbah, Kampung Seri Jaya, RPT Seri Rahmat, Taman Pinji Perdana, Taman Desa Pelancongan, Taman Yoke Kwan, Kampung Serani, RPT Batu ...

item.title: Perak Transit terminal on track - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak Transit terminal on track  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Perak Transit Bhd is on track to start the operation of its new 12-storey integrated public transportation terminal in Kampar, Perak, said managing director Datuk Seri Cheong Kong Fitt (pic). He said the terminal is expected to be completed in this quarter with gross leasable area of around 400,000 sq ft. “This is eight times bigger than Terminal AmanJaya’s gross leasable area,” he said. At the moment, Terminal AmanJaya is the main revenue contributor to the group, having more than 40% contribution. While the remaining came from petrol station and bus operations, which contri...

item.title: New airport snub behind ouster as Perak adviser too, claims tycoon - Malaysia Today
item.description:
New airport snub behind ouster as Perak adviser too, claims tycoon  Malaysia Today

(FMT) – A construction tycoon, whose appointment as Perak economic adviser was scuttled by the menteri besar over comments deemed insulting to the sultan, has claimed a further reason for his ouster. Koon Yew Yin said his removal from the Perak Economic Advisory Council (SEAC) was also due to his objection against a new airport to be built in Seri Iskandar, a township located about 50km southwest of Ipoh. He said he had suggested that the present Sultan Azlan Shah Airport in Ipoh have its runways upgraded instead to accommodate larger planes. He claimed this was agreed to by the state execu...

item.title: Palace denies tycoon’s claim that sultan stopped his appointment as Perak adviser - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Palace denies tycoon’s claim that sultan stopped his appointment as Perak adviser  Malaysia Today

(FMT) – The Perak palace has denied the claim by prominent tycoon Koon Yew Yin that his appointment as the state’s economic adviser was scuttled due to his claims that Datuk titles had been exchanged for money. Koon said after the May 9 general election, the Perak menteri besar’s secretary requested his postal address to send him a letter of appointment as the state economic adviser, but the appointment was stopped on the instruction from the palace. “The Perak sultan has absolutely no right under the Federal Constitution to stop my appointment, and he cannot tell the Perak menteri besar an...

item.title: Retirees flock to Perak, making it nation’s ‘oldest state’ - The Star Online
item.description:
Retirees flock to Perak, making it nation’s ‘oldest state’  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Perak is the “oldest” state in Malaysia this year with 14.9% of its population aged 60 and above. Perlis and Penang are next, with senior citizens making up 13.1% and 12.7% of their population respectively. Chief Statistician of Malaysia Datuk Seri Dr Mohd Uzir Mahidin said these areas outpaced other states in the country in terms of becoming an ageing population. “Many retirees de­­cide to reside in Perak because it doesn’t seem too hectic, but it’s still a big state,” he said after the Department of Statis­tics Datathon opening ceremony and StatsDigital launch at UniKL Busin...

item.title: Perak MB: Koon not in advisory council due to allegation against late Sultan - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Perak MB: Koon not in advisory council due to allegation against late Sultan  Malaysia Today

(The Star) – Perak Mentri Besar Ahmad Faizal Azumu (pic) has rebuked prominent businessman Koon Yew Yin for alleging that the Sultan of Perak had interfered with his appointment as a member of the State Economy Advisory Council. Ahmad Faizal denied the allegation, saying that Koon was no longer part of the council for another reason. “As the Mentri Besar, I wished to stress that the Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah has never interfered directly or indirectly on the matter. “The decision not to appoint Koon as one of the council members was my own,” he said in a statement on Fri...

item.title: Action council to oversee geopark - The Star Online
item.description:
Action council to oversee geopark  The Star Online

THE Perak government will set up a Perak Tourism Action Council (PTAC) soon to protect, maintain and conserve the newly proclaimed Kinta Valley as a National Geopark. State Tourism, Arts and Culture committee chairman Tan Kar Hing said the council would ensure tourism attractions in the state were properly managed. He said most of the geosites within the Kinta Valley were developed as tourist destinations, but these sites were not managed effectively. “With PTAC, the Perak State Park Corporation will receive extra support to enhance the management quality, and protection of attractions unde...

item.title: Perak win dramatic, sometimes ugly, Malaysia Cup final with two last gasp comebacks - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak win dramatic, sometimes ugly, Malaysia Cup final with two last gasp comebacks  The Star Online

SHAH ALAM: Perak ended their 18-year wait to lift their eighth Malaysia Cup trophy after a pulsating final. The Seladang team edged Terengganu 4-1 in a penalty shoot-out after the drama-laden match ended 3-3 after extra time. Both teams were reduced to playing with 10 men at the Shah Alam Stadium. Perak goalkeeper Muhammad Hafizul Hakim Khairul Nizam Jothy was the hero for the Silver State as he made two saves in the penalty shoot-out. Earlier Terengganu had taken the lead through skipper Kipre Tchetche's first half brace in the 1st and 42nd minute. Tchetche pounced on Perak's two defensive...

item.title: Efforts to improve river’s water quality pay off - The Star Online
item.description:
Efforts to improve river’s water quality pay off  The Star Online

THE water quality of Sungai Kinta in Ipoh has improved tremendously and is now classified as a Class Two category river. Perak Environment Department director Norazizi Adinan thanked Spark Foundation’s six-year smart partnership with various government agencies and local communities in making the effort a success. Norazizi said Class Two meant the water needed to undergo treatment before it could be used for consumption and recreational use. “I hope people will continue to preserve and conserve rivers in the state and the country as a whole. “We are very proud of this achievement and we hop...

item.title: Education Ministry: SVM examination to go on as scheduled on Monday - The Star Online
item.description:
Education Ministry: SVM examination to go on as scheduled on Monday  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The Malaysian Vocational Certificate (SVM) examination will go on as scheduled on Monday. The Education Ministry, in a statement, said that SVM's final evaluation will carried on as scheduled despite Perak's state holiday on Monday. "The Education Ministry would like to inform that the final evaluation of SVM Session Two for the Year 2018, which is scheduled on Oct 29, will be carried out as usual nationwide, including in Perak," it said in a statement. "The evaluation has to be carried out concurrently, as the necessary preparations have been made," it said. The Ministry add...

item.title: Perak are champions! - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak are champions!  The Star Online

SHAH ALAM: Perak ended their 18-year wait to lift their eighth Malaysia Cup trophy after a pulsating final. The Seladang edged Terengganu 4-1 in the penalty shootout after a thrilling match that ended 3-3 after extra time as both teams played with 10 men at the Shah Alam Stadium last night. Perak goalkeeper Muhammad Hafizul Hakim Khairul Nizam Jothy was the hero for the Silver State as he made two saves in the shootout. Terengganu had taken the lead through skipper Kipre Tchetche’s first-half brace in the first and 42nd minutes before Perak turned on the heat in the second half with goals f...

item.title: Coach Durakovic hails team after thrilling Malaysia Cup victory - The Star Online
item.description:
Coach Durakovic hails team after thrilling Malaysia Cup victory  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Perak coach Mehmet Durakovic heaped praises on his players’ fighting spirit as they defied the odds to clinch their eighth Malaysia Cup crown. The Seladang beat Terengganu 4-1 in the penalty shootout after the thrilling match ended 3-3 after extra time at the Shah Alam Stadium on Saturday. Durakovic’s men dug deep to draw level twice before emerging triumphant in the shootout with goalkeeper Muhammad Hafizul Hakim Khairul Nizam Jothy making two brilliant saves. Terengganu had taken the lead through skipper Kipre Tchetche’s first-half brace in the first and 42nd minute before ...

item.title: Cracks in homes, lamp posts collapse after non-stop rain in Perak - The Star Online
item.description:
Cracks in homes, lamp posts collapse after non-stop rain in Perak  The Star Online

IPOH: Continuous rain in several parts of Perak have left a trail of destruction, causing landslips and homes to crack. A Fire and Rescue Department spokesman said earth movement was reported at an orang asli village at Kg Pawong in Pos Raya near Simpang Pulai. He said cracks appeared on several houses but there were no casualties in the 3pm incident on Tuesday (Oct 23). In Gopeng, a land erosion caused several lamp posts to collapse. The incident took place at a residential area at Jalan Desa Cahaya 1 in Lawan Kuda at about 3.50pm. The situation is being monitored.

item.title: Perak and Pahang must control farming in Cameron to prevent landslides - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak and Pahang must control farming in Cameron to prevent landslides  The Star Online

IPOH: The Perak and Pahang state governments should stop issuing new permits for agriculture or development in Cameron Highlands to prevent further landslides, says Dr A. Xavier Jayakumar. The Water, Land and Natural Resources Minister said: “I really hope both states will also tighten enforcement on encroachment (into government or forest lands). "Those found guilty of illegal farming must face the music. “We need to use the full power of the law to make sure they stop such illegal activities,” he told reporters after Sultan of Perak Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah proclaimed Kinta Valley as...

item.title: Cop faints in mid-air, loses control of parachute, falls on house roof in Taiping - The Star Online
item.description:
Cop faints in mid-air, loses control of parachute, falls on house roof in Taiping  The Star Online

IPOH: A policeman fainted in mid-air and lost control of his parachute during a training exercise and then fell on a house roof in Taiping. The 33-year-old was injured after he fell on the roof of a house on Jalan Laksamana Asam Kumbang, Taiping, at about 11am on Friday (Oct 26), said a Fire and Rescue Department’s spokesperson. The parachute exercise was carried out at a height of 915m (3000ft) using a light aircraft. The spokesperson said it is believed when the victim had descended to 305m (1000m), he fainted and the parachute went out of control. That is how the policeman crashed on the...

item.title: Relocation a blessing in disguise - The Star Online
item.description:
Relocation a blessing in disguise  The Star Online

THERE was uncertainty when news first surfaced that a section of the village had to make way for tin mining activities. But it turned out to be a blessing in disguise for the affected villagers in Kampung Papan about 20km from Ipoh city centre. They were relocated nearby and their houses were rebuilt on a 45ft by 80ft plot. The village was named Kampung Baru Papan Baru. Recalling that episode 40 years ago, Cheah Kow said it was a dream come true as his family would not have been able to own a house on their own. “We were very poor and lived in a rented house in Kampung Papan for RM12 a mon...

item.title: Earth fissures damage six orang asli houses near Simpang Pulai - The Star Online
item.description:
Earth fissures damage six orang asli houses near Simpang Pulai  The Star Online

IPOH: Six orang asli houses were destroyed after earth fissures measuring 1.2m wide was reported at Kampung Pawong, near Simpang Pulai on Tuesday (Oct 23). Perak Minerals and Geoscience Department (JMG) director Ahmad Zukni Ahmad Khalil said there were 15 houses, and a surau at the area. He said the fissures was 50m long, and 1.5m in depth, and parallel to the riverbank. The houses, he said were located 10m away from the riverbank which is 60m in height. "However, three houses were badly effected. "The occupants from the six houses must move out, and stay at the other houses nearby," he sai...

item.title: Terengganu 2-0 up at half time, look set to win Malaysia Cup - The Star Online
item.description:
Terengganu 2-0 up at half time, look set to win Malaysia Cup  The Star Online

Terengganu are in the drivers seat to lift the Malaysia Cup. At half time, the east coast side are leading Perak 2-0 at the Shah Alam Stadium thanks to a brace from their talismanic skipper Kipre Tchetche. The Ivory Coast hitman pounced on a poor backpass from Mohd Idris Ahmad and easily sidestepped goalkeeper Muhammad Hafizul Hakim Khairul Nizam Jothy to slot in the first goal in the very first minute. Perak seemed to have equalised in the 30th minute from a corner kick but the goal was ruled out by referee Suresh Jayaraman due to a foul on Terengganu goalkeeper Mohd Suffian Ab Rahman Kung...

item.title: ‘Extend runway for larger aircraft’ - The Star Online
item.description:
‘Extend runway for larger aircraft’  The Star Online

IT IS more cost-effective to upgrade the Sultan Azlan Shah Airport than building a new one, said Perak Investment, Industry and Regional Development Committee chairman Datuk Seri Mohammad Nizar Jamaluddin. He said building a new international airport would be costly, but extending the runway at the current airport in Ipoh would be cheaper. He added that if this took place, 200 residents living near the airport would have to be compensated. “We will need to pay about RM1mil to each household and relocate them. “RM200mil is still cheaper than building a new airport but this is only a suggesti...

item.title: Helpless in bid to save farmlands - The Star Online
item.description:
Helpless in bid to save farmlands  The Star Online

HER lethargic face reveals the turmoil within her mind. At 88, Chu Yau who lost her 90-year-old husband Foong Kam earlier this year, was dealt another blow recently. The oil palm trees which the couple had planted and depended on for a living will soon be gone. A sand mining contractor started bulldozing the trees a week ago. “They (oil palm trees) are my coffin money,” she said when met at Kampung Baru Kuala Bikam. Chu said the couple raised their eight children through farming in the village. They used to plant vegetables before switching to oil palm as it was less labour intensive. “We n...

item.title: Nizar says Perak would have surpassed Selangor, Penang if he wasn't ousted - The Star Online
item.description:
Nizar says Perak would have surpassed Selangor, Penang if he wasn't ousted  The Star Online

IPOH: Former Perak Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Mohammad Nizar Jamaluddin says the state's economy would have been on par with or better than Selangor and Penang, had he stayed on or the federal government changed power in 2008. Mohammad Nizar, who is currently the state Industry, Investment and Corridor Development Committee chairman, said there was no cooperation between the state and the federal government. He said the Barisan government then kept sabotaging the state's development plans. "There was no support or cooperation. "Had I also stayed on, the state would be on par or even better tha...

item.title: Collision at Tg Malim train station causes slight delay to ETS, commuter service - The Star Online
item.description:
Collision at Tg Malim train station causes slight delay to ETS, commuter service  The Star Online

IPOH: An accident between a cargo train and a KTMB commuter train occurred at the Tanjung Malim station on Thursday morning (Oct 18), and is expected to cause a slight delay to the Electric Train Service for northern sector. KTM's Tanjung Malim-Kepong commuter service will also be affected. A KTMB spokesman said on its Facebook page that the incident occurred at about 6am. Nobody was harmed in the accidentt. “The disruption in services only involved one track between Tanjung Malim and Kuala Kubu Baru. The ETS for the northern sector will experience a delay in journeys between 10 and 15 minu...

item.title: MB offers incentives to Perak footballers at Malaysia Cup - The Star Online
item.description:
MB offers incentives to Perak footballers at Malaysia Cup  The Star Online

PERAK Mentri Besar Ahmad Faizal Azumu has promised to provide incentives to the state football team players if they perform well in the Malaysia Cup. The team are on course of entering the final following their 5-0 win against Sabah in the first leg of the semifinal match last week. Ahmad Faizal said, “All the players will get incentives from me personally, but they will get different amounts. “I hope they will give their all in training and try to get into starting 11,” he told reporters during a lunch with the state players here. “The starting 11 may get RM15,000 each while those in reser...

item.title: Probe on KTM Komuter-cargo train collision in Tanjung Malim underway, says Transport Ministry - The Star Online
item.description:
Probe on KTM Komuter-cargo train collision in Tanjung Malim underway, says Transport Ministry  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Transport Minister Anthony Loke (pic) has received a preliminary report on a train accident that happened on Thursday morning (Oct 18), and says a detailed investigation is underway. "An accident happened at the Tanjung Malim train station in Perak this morning, involving a KTM Komuter train and cargo train," he said. "A detailed investigation will be carried out to find out which party is responsible for the accident." Loke said he viewed the matter seriously as the accident could have been avoided. "There are existing train signalling and other systems in place. Plus trains...

item.title: Perak inks RM1.9bil investment deals - The Star Online
item.description:
Perak inks RM1.9bil investment deals  The Star Online

INVESTPERAK, the state’s investment promotion agency, and Gas Malaysia Bhd have signed investment pacts with five local companies worth about RM1.9bil. Perak Mentri Besar Ahmad Faizal Azumu said the biggest investment was the RM1.1bil agreement signed with Malayan Flour Mills Bhd to build an agro-food industry manufacturing plant in the state. “We have also signed an agreement with Top Glove Bhd, that will invest RM100mil to build a glove manufacturing factory in Ipoh. “InvestPerak will also collaborate with Central Medicare Sdn Bhd to build another glove factory in Changkat Jong, Teluk Int...

item.title: Still bustling after 70 years - The Star Online
item.description:
Still bustling after 70 years  The Star Online

WHILE many people are still asleep, a family in Kampung Baru Simee prepares to head to the market to set up their kuih stall. Pe Peng Shun runs his business from 5am to 7.30am, so getting up early to face the day is a norm for him. A typical day for Pe and his family begins at 1am as they prepare kuih in the wee hours of the morning. With six people working to prepare the kuih, Pe’s team comprises his wife Foong Yoke Yin, children including his visually-impaired 26-year-old son, and his sister-in-law. Chow operates a food truck selling soya milk and ‘taufu fah’, and Kampung Baru Simee is on...
